item.title: Galleries
item.dc:creator: demoadmin
item.content:encoded: This is how a regular gallery looks when you include it in the textbox. WordPress standard thumbnail size is used by default, 150x150px. This can be changed from the Settings > Media page in the dashboard, to make larger thumbnails more sharp for retina and screen (This demo uses 300x300px). Captions appear on hover for galleries with 1-4 columns. Standard lightbox functionality for the images has not been built in, as there are plenty of plugins to choose from that adds such a feature. This demo site uses a plugin called "light". Upload and activate it, and it will all work. item.title: Quote Format Post
item.dc:creator: demoadmin
item.content:encoded:
This is a quote format post. You can post it without having any text below like this as well. It is good to have text below if you use thumbnail version of blog, instead of post format (full entries directly on home page). You can choose between the following templates for every single post: Default (with post/sidebar), Full Width (no sidebar at all) and Full Width Post Format (only expands post format at the top, includes sidebar below). item.title: Gallery Format Post
item.dc:creator: demoadmin
item.content:encoded:
Simply upload images to a specific post in WordPress, and select the "Gallery" post format, and it will automatically turn into a nice slider. It also smoothly resizes the slider height depending on each image's size. You can choose between the following templates for every single post: Default (with post/sidebar), Full Width (no sidebar at all) and Full Width Post Format (only expands post format at the top, includes sidebar below). item.title: Aside Format Post
item.dc:creator: demoadmin
item.content:encoded: This is an aside format post, it basically only leaves out the title from the default format. You can still access the single page by clicking on the thumbnail or comment bubble. This format could be useful when you don't want a title, just text. You can choose between the following templates for every single post: Default (with post/sidebar), Full Width (no sidebar at all) and Full Width Post Format (only expands post format at the top, includes sidebar below).
